pages.text: Another thing every buddycard has is Power. When played, a buddy's starting power is determined by what is written on the card next to what looks like a sword, and will be displayed while in play. A green power number is equal to or above its starting power, yellow is under, and red is critically low. This power is the damage they will deal to the opponent while attacking.

When you end your turn, before it goes to your next turn, your buddies attack. When you do one, each one attacks either the opponent, or the opponents buddy in front of them, for their power, but be careful, because an opposing buddy will fight back. When fighting another buddy, each one loses power equal to the other's power, and will die if they go below 0.

Each player starts the game with 20 health. While they can regain health through abilities, if they lose all 20 health, they lose. To beat your opponent, you must hit them with enough damage to deplete their life.

It is worth noting, some abilities or status effects, such as sleep, can cancel fighting. These would be either fight or damage triggers. When a creature doesn't fight, the other creature will not fight back.
